title: SK Innovation subsidized for Hungarian battery plant
notes:
Location:
- The project is located in Hungary, with the second plant in Komárom and the third plant in Iváncsa, 50 kilometers southwest of Budapest.

Capacity:
- The second battery cell plant in Komárom is planned to have an annual capacity of 10 GWh. The third battery cell factory in Iváncsa is not mentioned in terms of capacity.

Investment amounts:
- SK Innovation is investing about 945 billion won (approximately 700 million euros) in the construction of its second plant in Komárom. Additionally, the company received a subsidy of 90 million euros from the Hungarian government for the second plant.

Project progress:
- Construction of the second plant in Komárom is planned to be completed in the current year, with commercial production expected to begin in 2022. There is no specific information about the progress of the third plant in Iváncsa.

Project type:
- The project involves the construction of a new battery cell plant in Komárom and a new battery cell factory in Iváncsa.

Value chain stages:
- The article mentions that SK Innovation currently only develops and produces pouch cells. The company is also looking into the development and production of new types of battery cells, including cylindrical and prismatic cells, to expand their customer base. There is no specific information about the stages covered at the facilities.

title: SK Innovation to build $859mn EV battery plant in Hungary
notes:
Location:
- The project is located in Komárom, Hungary.

Capacity:
- The original facility in Komárom has a capacity of 7.5GW per hour, and the new No.2 Komarom plant is expected to add to this capacity.

Investment amounts:
- SK Innovation has announced an investment of US$859mn for the construction of the new electric vehicle battery plant in Hungary. The original facility in Komárom cost approximately $350mn.

Project progress:
- SK Innovation began construction of the first plant in 2018, and the new No.2 Komarom plant is expected to be completed in 2021. The decision to build the new plant is part of SK Innovation’s initiative to strengthen its operations and presence in the European region.

Project type:
- The new plant in Hungary is an expansion of the first plant in Europe.

Value chain stages:
- The facility covers the stages of cell fabrication and module assembly.

title: SK Innovation To Build Third EV Battery Plant In Hungary
notes:
Location:
- Hungary, with the new factory to be located in Ivancsa.

Capacity:
- The new factory is planned to produce up to 30 GWh of cells annually, with the company's current global capacity standing at about 40 GWh annually.

Investment amounts:
- The initial investment in the new site is reported to be 1.3 trillion won ($1.16 billion), with the total cost expected to reach 2.6 trillion won ($2.3 billion) by 2028.
- Hungary plans to provide a significant investment subsidy, which will be the biggest in its history, to attract the plant.

Project progress:
- Construction is scheduled to start in the third quarter of this year, with the start of production planned for early 2024. The plant is expected to be fully completed by 2028.

Project type:
- The new factory is a new build, with the company already operating a 7.5 GWh factory in Komarom and building the second 10 GWh factory at the same site.

Value chain stages:
- The facility will cover cell fabrication, where cathode and anode are combined with an electrolyte, and module assembly.

title: SK Innovation uses green loan to expand EV battery manufacturing in Europe

title: SK Innovation to invest 750 million euros in Hungarian battery plant
notes:
Location:
- The battery production project is located in Komarom, northern Hungary.

Capacity:
- The project aims to increase battery production capacity to 60GWh by 2022.

Investment amounts:
- SK Innovation is investing an additional 239 billion forint (750 million euro) in the plant in Komarom, Hungary.
- The government is in negotiations to provide non-returnable funding for the project.

Project progress:
- Construction of the facility is set to begin in March, with production expected to commence in late 2021 or early 2022.

Project type:
- The project is an expansion of SK Innovation's first plant in Europe.

Value chain stages:
- The facility will manufacture batteries for electric vehicles, covering cell fabrication and module assembly stages.

title: SK Innovation raises 500 million US dollars to build the second battery factory in Hungary
notes:
Location:
- Hungary (Komarom and Ivancsa)

Capacity:
- The second electric car battery factory in Komarom, Hungary is under construction, and the company plans to build a third Hungarian battery plant in Ivancsa with an annual capacity of 30GWh.

Investment amounts:
- SK Innovation raised a $500m green loan from the Export-Import Bank of Korea to support the construction of its second electric car battery factory in Komarom, Hungary. The company has raised more than $3 billion in green financing for its overseas electric car battery and diaphragm plants.

Project progress:
- SK Innovation is in the process of constructing its second electric car battery factory in Komarom, Hungary. Additionally, the company plans to build a third Hungarian battery plant in Ivancsa.

Project type:
- New build

Value chain stages:
- The articles do not provide specific information on the value chain stages covered at the facility.

title: SK Battery Hungary
notes:
Location:
- Country: Hungary
- Region: Komárom-Esztergom

Capacity:
- The first electric battery plant in Komárom is expected to launch production in August 2020.
- Another battery plant in the same town is under construction and is expected to begin operation in late 2021.
- The combined investment cost of the two factories amounts to HUF 416 billion (roughly €1.2 billion as of 23 April 2020).

Investment amounts:
- The combined investment cost of the two factories amounts to HUF 416 billion (roughly €1.2 billion as of 23 April 2020).

Project progress:
- The Hungarian subsidiary of South Korean chemical enterprise SK Innovation is expected to launch production in its first Hungary-based electric battery plant in Komárom in August 2020.
- Another battery plant is under construction in the same town and is expected to begin operation in late 2021.
- The factories are projected to create some 1,410 jobs, with the combined workforce potentially reaching 2,500 by 2023.
- The Hungarian site is the Korean firm’s first foreign location.

Project type:
- Business expansion

Value chain stages:
- The factories will manufacture batteries for electric cars.

N/A for subsidies and specific progress milestones.
